issues.message:
Non-empty arrays are mutable, so this `public static final` array is not a constant and can be modified by clients of this class.  Prefer an ImmutableList, or provide an accessor method that returns a defensive copy.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MutablePublicArray)

Non-empty arrays are mutable, so this `public static final` array is not a constant and can be modified by clients of this class.  Prefer an ImmutableList, or provide an accessor method that returns a defensive copy.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MutablePublicArray)

Non-empty arrays are mutable, so this `public static final` array is not a constant and can be modified by clients of this class.  Prefer an ImmutableList, or provide an accessor method that returns a defensive copy.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MutablePublicArray)

Non-empty arrays are mutable, so this `public static final` array is not a constant and can be modified by clients of this class.  Prefer an ImmutableList, or provide an accessor method that returns a defensive copy.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MutablePublicArray)

Non-empty arrays are mutable, so this `public static final` array is not a constant and can be modified by clients of this class.  Prefer an ImmutableList, or provide an accessor method that returns a defensive copy.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/MutablePublicArray)

Specify a `Locale` when calling `String#to{Lower,Upper}Case`. (Note: there are multiple suggested fixes; the third may be most appropriate if you're dealing with ASCII Strings.)
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/StringCaseLocaleUsage)
  Did you mean 'employee.getFirstName().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT) + "." + employee.getLastName().toLowerCase() + "@em.com");' or 'employee.getFirstName().toLowerCase(Locale.getDefault()) + "." + employee.getLastName().toLowerCase() + "@em.com");' or 'Ascii.toLowerCase(employee.getFirstName()) + "." + employee.getLastName().toLowerCase() + "@em.com");'?

Specify a `Locale` when calling `String#to{Lower,Upper}Case`. (Note: there are multiple suggested fixes; the third may be most appropriate if you're dealing with ASCII Strings.)
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/StringCaseLocaleUsage)
  Did you mean 'employee.getFirstName().toLowerCase() + "." + employee.getLastName().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT) + "@em.com");' or 'employee.getFirstName().toLowerCase() + "." + employee.getLastName().toLowerCase(Locale.getDefault()) + "@em.com");' or 'employee.getFirstName().toLowerCase() + "." + Ascii.toLowerCase(employee.getLastName()) + "@em.com");'?

LocalDate.now() is not allowed because it silently uses the system default time-zone. You must pass an explicit time-zone (e.g., ZoneId.of("America/Los_Angeles")) to this method.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaTimeDefaultTimeZone)
  Did you mean 'jobInfo.setHireDate(LocalDate.now(ZoneId.systemDefault()));'?

The field 'LOGGER' is never read.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/UnusedVariable)
  Did you mean to remove this line or 'static { org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger(LeaveUtils.class); }'?

You should almost never invoke the Enum.ordinal() method or depend on the enum values by index.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/EnumOrdinal)

The type `AbstractMap.SimpleEntry` was referred to by the non-canonical name `EnumMap.SimpleEntry`. This may be misleading.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/NonCanonicalType)
  Did you mean 'return new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<>(leave, balance - leaveDays);'?

Specify a `Locale` when calling `String#to{Lower,Upper}Case`. (Note: there are multiple suggested fixes; the third may be most appropriate if you're dealing with ASCII Strings.)
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/StringCaseLocaleUsage)
  Did you mean 'LOG.info("Added {}/{} {}s...", addedCount, count, role.name().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT));' or 'LOG.info("Added {}/{} {}s...", addedCount, count, role.name().toLowerCase(Locale.getDefault()));' or 'LOG.info("Added {}/{} {}s...", addedCount, count, Ascii.toLowerCase(role.name()));'?

Specify a `Locale` when calling `String#to{Lower,Upper}Case`. (Note: there are multiple suggested fixes; the third may be most appropriate if you're dealing with ASCII Strings.)
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/StringCaseLocaleUsage)
  Did you mean 'LOG.info("Finished adding {}s. Added: {}, Skipped (already existed): {}", role.name().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT), addedCount,' or 'LOG.info("Finished adding {}s. Added: {}, Skipped (already existed): {}", role.name().toLowerCase(Locale.getDefault()), addedCount,' or 'LOG.info("Finished adding {}s. Added: {}, Skipped (already existed): {}", Ascii.toLowerCase(role.name()), addedCount,'?

Date has a bad API that leads to bugs; prefer java.time.Instant or LocalDate.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaUtilDate)

Date has a bad API that leads to bugs; prefer java.time.Instant or LocalDate.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaUtilDate)

Date has a bad API that leads to bugs; prefer java.time.Instant or LocalDate.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaUtilDate)

    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaUtilDate)

Date has a bad API that leads to bugs; prefer java.time.Instant or LocalDate.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JavaUtilDate)

Specify a `Locale` when calling `String#to{Lower,Upper}Case`. (Note: there are multiple suggested fixes; the third may be most appropriate if you're dealing with ASCII Strings.)
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/StringCaseLocaleUsage)
  Did you mean 'authorities.add(new SimpleGrantedAuthority("ROLE_" + role.toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT)));' or 'authorities.add(new SimpleGrantedAuthority("ROLE_" + role.toUpperCase(Locale.getDefault())));' or 'authorities.add(new SimpleGrantedAuthority("ROLE_" + Ascii.toUpperCase(role)));'?

The field 'APPLICATION_LOGGER' is never read.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/UnusedVariable)
  Did you mean to remove this line or 'static { org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger(EmployeeController.class); }'?

The field 'LOGGER' is never read.
    (see https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/UnusedVariable)
  Did you mean to remove this line or 'static { org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.getLogger(CustomUserDetailsService.class); }'?
